name: The Crown Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for three nights in early May 2009. First impressions weren't that good: our bedroom was pretty small and situated in a small block of three rooms adjoining the large car park and separate from the pub itself. My wife said it looked like the toilet block from the outside, which was prophetic as someone later tried to get into our room thinking it was just that!
reviews.title: Pleased we stayed here - but not perfect!
Looks beautiful but looks deceive!
reviews.text: However, our mood improved when we went into the pub. It's very foodie with only a small public bar but the whole place is full of character. And the food was excellent and well above average for pub grub. Try the slow cooked pork belly or shoulder of lamb and you'll see what I mean. It was also good to see that much of the food & drink was sourced from local quality suppliers.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The other big plus for us was the quality of the staff. Without exception they were efficient, friendly and knowledgable despite being extremely busy for most of the time. I'm not sure the previous reviewer from Birmingham was reviewing the right place! So would we stay here again? On initial impressions I would have said no, but this place grew on us and we will probably be back. But we won't stay in a room next to the car park again!
reviews.title: a little gem

reviews.text: A beautiful building in an idyllic setting with a large menu and extensive wine list. Moule Mariniere was terrible with hacked chunks of onion, bearded uncleaned mussels, grit and covered in barnacles.......sent back. Replaced with Chicken salad that returned covered in sauce, eight anchovies and bagged limp pre-packed salad leaves.....sent back (I specifically asked for chicken salad with no cheese, no crutons and nothing on it....I have chron's disease) Chips were over cooked and greasy (dripping!) and the burger bun was mass produced and tasteless. Lovely building , very apologetic staff and the worst food I've every had.
reviews.title: A great find

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: this was our first experience of bed and breakfast and what a place to start.A truly lovely proper old inn with friendly staff,excellent service and great food and beers.our room was spotlessly clean and comfortable with everything you need for a short stay.we will definitely go back again.
reviews.title: A Cornish Cracker

description: A delightful 12th Century country inn in the heart of Cornwall. Close to many major attractions including the Eden Project, Lanhydrock and the harbour town of Fowey, the Crown Inn is a superb place to stay. With roaring log fires in the winter and tranquil gardens in the summer, you can step into our own little world when you visit the Crown Inn! If you are looking for pub accommodation in Cornwall near Lostwithiel, St Austell, Bodmin or Fowey, look no further than The Crown Inn.
